sleep_index.title: Your Sleep Index trend over the last 3 weeks
sleep_index.description: The sleep index is designed to be one single metric you need to judge your sleep health, using several contributors like total sleep duration, resting HR, restfulness.

insights.description: Your overall sleep index has gone down compared to the previous week. Checkout which contributors to fix and how to improve them.

best_contributors.title: Temperature Deviation
best_contributors.description: Your core temperature drops by a degree or two just before and during sleep, then begins to rise a few hours before you wake up. This pattern is a measure of temperature deviation.

best_contributors.title: HRV Form
best_contributors.description: This metric represents the HRV trend across the duration of your sleep.

worst_contributors.title: Total Sleep
worst_contributors.description: It represents the volume of uninterrupted sleep every night for your body.

insights.title: How to improve Total Sleep
insights.description: Optimum supplementation of magnesium is known to keep you asleep for longer.

worst_contributors.title: Timing
worst_contributors.description: This represents the adherence to your Circadian Rhythm.

insights.title: How to improve Consistency
insights.description: Maintain a sleep ritual to improve restfulness. Popular rituals include listening to calming music, avoiding screens, making your bed, and taking a warm shower before sleep.

worst_contributors.title: Restorative Sleep
worst_contributors.description: Restorative sleep measures the contributions of REM and deep sleep.

insights.title: How to improve Restorative Sleep
insights.description: Clearing your mind before bed is crucial. Having a relaxation routine increases the likelihood of restorative sleep.

recovery_index.title: Your Recovery Index trend over the last 3 weeks
recovery_index.description: The Recovery Score indicates your overall state of 'well-being'. It depends on markers like resting heart rate, hrv, temperature, sleep quality, movement and recovery.

insights.description: Your overall recovery index has gone down compared to the previous week. Check out which contributors to fix and how to improve them.

best_contributors.title: Temperature
best_contributors.description: Your body temperature is an indicator of your body's state of recovery

best_contributors.title: Resting Heart Rate
best_contributors.description: Resting Heart Rate (RHR) is an indicator of your overall cardiovascular health and fitness level. A lower RHR typically signifies better cardiovascular fitness and efficient heart function, while a higher RHR can indicate stress, overtraining, dehydration, or potential health issues.

best_contributors.title: HRV Form
best_contributors.description: This metric reflects your HRV patterns and variations, which indicate your body's adaptability.

worst_contributors.title: Sleep Quotient
worst_contributors.description: Sleep quality and duration are factored into this metric.

insights.title: How to improve Sleep Quotient
insights.description: Avoiding food 2-3 hours before bedtime can improve sleep quality. When your digestive system is still active, it can prevent your body from entering a restful state, resulting in less restorative sleep.

worst_contributors.title: Movement Index
worst_contributors.description: This represents your overall movement trends.

insights.title: How to improve Movement Index
insights.description: Moving for 4 minutes and stretching for 1 minute every hour is a simple yet highly effective way to improve posture, circulation, and energy expenditure.

movement_index.title: Your Movement Index trend over the last 3 weeks
movement_index.description: The Movement Index is designed to keep you moving for optimal glucose metabolism and increase your non-exercise energy usage. It's a measure of how active you were that day.

insights.description: Your overall movement index has improved compared to the previous week. Check out which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: Active Hours
best_contributors.description: This measures how active you are for at least one period each hour throughout the day.

best_contributors.title: Workout Frequency
best_contributors.description: This metric tracks the number of days you were highly active and the number of workouts you completed, providing a long-term measure of your overall activity.
